antichess
Interface HumanPlayer<M extends Move>

All Superinterfaces:
GamePlayer<M>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ChessPlayer
public interface HumanPlayer<M extends Move>
extends GamePlayer<M>

This interface handles interactions between the Controller and the View The HumanPlayer facilitates the communication between the GameController and the BoardView class. The typical communication bewtween the classes works in this manner: controller calls getMove. The HumanPlayer tells the BoardView to acceptInput. When the BoardView has input it notifies the HumanPlayer. The HumanPlayer checks for legality in the move. If the move is legal it notifies the controller that it has a move.

Author:
nlharr
Specification Fields
  • board //Board stores the board the HumanPlayer is interacting with
  • controller //controller specifies the GameController that this HumanPlayer is controlled by
  • boardView //BoardView that the HumanPlayer asks for moves
  • currentMove //stores the currentMove to be updated to by the GameController

Method Summary
 M getMove(GameController controller)
          Asks the player for a move, if the player has a move the move is returned, if the player doesn't, null is returned immediately Once this GamePlayer is able to return a valid move it calls notifyControllerHasMove() on the controller.

Description copied from interface: GamePlayer
Asks the player for a move, if the player has a move the move is returned, if the player doesn't, null is returned immediately Once this GamePlayer is able to return a valid move it calls notifyControllerHasMove() on the controller.

setMove

boolean setMove(int[] startRows,
                int[] startColumns,
                int[] destinationRows,
                int[] destinationColumns)
Returns:
true if the move between the start and destination is legal else false
Requires:
startRows, startColumns, destinationRows, destinationColumnes are all not null
Effects:
if the move between the start and destination is legal it sets currentMove to that move
Modifies:
currentMove

notifyHasMove

void notifyHasMove()
Notifies the controller that requested a move if it has a move

Throws:
RuntimeException - if no move has been requested so there is no controller to return a value to
